Were your friends mainly Jewish or Miss Jew?
Mostly because of the clubs, you know, I went to clubs and that's where I met.
But I had my school friends as well who would always come to a party, you know.

We'd have parties and everybody.
We had a field, we had a big garden, the bottom of the garden, it's all built over now.
We called it the Wimpy Estate, it's all built up all behind there.
We had a field and in the field we had chickens and a couple of goats and a couple of geese
that used to frighten the life out of us because they were very friendly.
And a horse, which was, my sister was the horse rider, she had a pony, I should really say.
And she absolutely loved it.
Even though there's only 18 months between us, when you're a child,
a sister 18 months older than you doesn't, you know, doesn't want to know you really.
So she was the one and her friends, a lot of her friends had horses or ponies
and she used to take it to like pony club events but frightened the life out of me.
I wasn't a horse rider, I may have been daring in some things but horse riding wasn't for me.
You were jealous?
I wasn't jealous, no.
My father did a silly thing to me, it was his fault I didn't like.
It's a silly story, I don't know if you want silly stories.
But he made me get on the horse and I got on and then he threw a stick at the horse
so the horse would run off with me sitting on it and that was it, finished.
I wasn't, I wouldn't go on the horse again.
So it was his weird sense of humour I reckon.
It was his weird sense of humour I reckon.
Perhaps he didn't want to buy another horse.
He didn't want to buy another horse.

So you had two sisters and a brother?
